Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SNS topic.
Misconfigurations.Description: Topics should be encrypted to protect their contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Topic does not have encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SNS Topic encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SQS queue.
Misconfigurations.Description: Queues should be encrypted to protect queue contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Queue is not encrypted
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SQS Queue encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SQS queue.
Misconfigurations.Description: Queues should be encrypted to protect queue contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Queue is not encrypted
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SQS Queue encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: No HEALTHCHECK defined
Misconfigurations.Description: You should add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your docker container images to perform the health check on running containers.
Misconfigurations.Message: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in your Dockerfile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add HEALTHCHECK instruction in Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SNS topic.
Misconfigurations.Description: Topics should be encrypted to protect their contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Topic does not have encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SNS Topic encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SNS topic.
Misconfigurations.Description: Topics should be encrypted to protect their contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Topic does not have encryption enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SNS Topic encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Point in time recovery should be enabled to protect DynamoDB table
Misconfigurations.Description:
DynamoDB tables should be protected against accidentally or malicious write/delete actions by ensuring that there is adequate protection.
By enabling point-in-time-recovery you can restore to a known point in the event of loss of data.
Misconfigurations.Message: Point-in-time recovery is not enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable point in time recovery

Misconfigurations.Title: DynamoDB tables should use at rest encryption with a Customer Managed Key
Misconfigurations.Description: Using AWS managed keys does not allow for fine grained control. DynamoDB tables are encrypted by default using AWS managed encryption keys. To increase control of the encryption and control the management of factors like key rotation, use a Customer Managed Key.
Misconfigurations.Message: Table encryption does not use a customer-managed KMS key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable server side encryption with a customer managed key

Misconfigurations.Title: Kinesis stream is unencrypted.
Misconfigurations.Description: Kinesis streams should be encrypted to ensure sensitive data is kept private. Additionally, non-default KMS keys should be used so granularity of access control can be ensured.
Misconfigurations.Message: Stream does not use KMS encryption.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable in transit encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: MQ Broker should have audit logging enabled
Misconfigurations.Description: Logging should be enabled to allow tracing of issues and activity to be investigated more fully. Logs provide additional information and context which is often invalauble during investigation
Misconfigurations.Message: Broker does not have audit logging enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable audit logging

Misconfigurations.Title: MQ Broker should have general logging enabled
Misconfigurations.Description: Logging should be enabled to allow tracing of issues and activity to be investigated more fully. Logs provide additional information and context which is often invalauble during investigation
Misconfigurations.Message: Broker does not have general logging enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable general logging

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SQS queue.
Misconfigurations.Description: Queues should be encrypted to protect queue contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Queue is not encrypted
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SQS Queue encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Unencrypted SQS queue.
Misconfigurations.Description: Queues should be encrypted to protect queue contents.
Misconfigurations.Message: Queue is not encrypted
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Turn on SQS Queue encryption

Misconfigurations.Title: Secrets Manager should use customer managed keys
Misconfigurations.Description: Secrets Manager encrypts secrets by default using a default key created by AWS. To ensure control and granularity of secret encryption, CMK's should be used explicitly.
Misconfigurations.Message: Secret explicitly uses the default key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: Image user should not be 'root'
Misconfigurations.Description: Running containers with 'root' user can lead to a container escape situation. It is a best practice to run containers as non-root users, which can be done by adding a 'USER' statement to the Dockerfile.
Misconfigurations.Message: Specify at least 1 USER command in Dockerfile with non-root user as argument
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'USER <non root user name>' line to the Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory
Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd … && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.
Misconfigurations.Message: RUN should not be used to change directory: 'cd /root  && yum install -y yum-utils spectool deltarpm  && yum-builddep -y automake'. Use 'WORKDIR' statement instead.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use WORKDIR to change directory

Misconfigurations.Title: 'RUN cd ...' to change directory
Misconfigurations.Description: Use WORKDIR instead of proliferating instructions like 'RUN cd … && do-something', which are hard to read, troubleshoot, and maintain.
Misconfigurations.Message: RUN should not be used to change directory: 'cd /root  && yumdownloader --source automake  && rpm -i automake-1.13.*.amzn2.src.rpm  && cd /root/rpmbuild  && patch -p0 < ../automake-1.13-to-1.16-spec.patch  && spectool -g -R SPECS/automake.spec  && rpmbuild -ba SPECS/automake.spec --nocheck  && yum install -y RPMS/noarch/*'. Use 'WORKDIR' statement instead.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use WORKDIR to change directory

Misconfigurations.Title: 'yum clean all' missing
Misconfigurations.Description: You should use 'yum clean all' after using a 'yum install' command to clean package cached data and reduce image size.
Misconfigurations.Message: 'yum clean all' is missed: cd /root  && yum install -y yum-utils spectool deltarpm  && yum-builddep -y automake
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'yum clean all' to Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Title: 'yum clean all' missing

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add 'yum clean all' to Dockerfile

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Only use immutable images in ECR

Misconfigurations.Title: ECR repository has image scans disabled.
Misconfigurations.Description: Repository image scans should be enabled to ensure vulnerable software can be discovered and remediated as soon as possible.
Misconfigurations.Message: Image scanning is not enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ECR image scanning

Misconfigurations.Title: ECR images tags shouldn't be mutable.
Misconfigurations.Description: ECR images should be set to IMMUTABLE to prevent code injection through image mutation. This can be done by setting image_tag_mutability to IMMUTABLE
Misconfigurations.Message: Repository tags are mutable.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Only use immutable images in ECR

Misconfigurations.Title: ECR Repository should use customer managed keys to allow more control
Misconfigurations.Description: Images in the ECR repository are encrypted by default using AWS managed encryption keys. To increase control of the encryption and control the management of factors like key rotation, use a Customer Managed Key.
Misconfigurations.Message: Repository is not encrypted using KMS.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Use customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket has logging disabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add a logging block to the resource to enable access logging

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not ignore public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 encryption should use Customer Managed Keys
Misconfigurations.Description: Encryption using AWS keys provides protection for your S3 buckets. To increase control of the encryption and manage factors like rotation use customer managed keys.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not encrypt data with a customer managed key.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption using customer managed keys

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: A KMS key is not configured to auto-rotate.
Misconfigurations.Description: You should configure your KMS keys to auto rotate to maintain security and defend against compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Key does not have rotation enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Configure KMS key to auto rotate

Misconfigurations.Title: CloudWatch log groups should be encrypted using CMK
Misconfigurations.Description: CloudWatch log groups are encrypted by default, however, to get the full benefit of controlling key rotation and other KMS aspects a KMS CMK should be used.
Misconfigurations.Message: Log group is not encrypted.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable CMK encryption of CloudWatch Log Groups

Misconfigurations.Title: Missing description for security group.
Misconfigurations.Description:
Security groups should include a description for auditing purposes.

Simplifies auditing, debugging, and managing security groups.
Misconfigurations.Message: Security group does not have a description.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Add descriptions for all security groups

Misconfigurations.Title: AWS best practice to not use the default VPC for workflows
Misconfigurations.Description: Default VPC does not have a lot of the critical security features that standard VPC comes with, new resources should not be created in the default VPC and it should not be present in the Terraform.
Misconfigurations.Message: Default VPC is used.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a non-default vpc for resources to be created in

Misconfigurations.Title: Network ACLs should not allow unrestricted ingress to SSH or RDP from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Description:
The Network Access Control List (NACL) function provide stateless filtering of ingress and
egress network traffic to AWS resources. It is recommended that no NACL allows
unrestricted ingress access to remote server administration ports, such as SSH to port 22
and RDP to port 3389.
Misconfigurations.Message: Network ACL rule allows unrestricted ingress from any IP address.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a more restrictive CIDR range

Misconfigurations.Title: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
Misconfigurations.Description: VPC Flow Logs provide visibility into network traffic that traverses the VPC and can be used to detect anomalous traffic or insight during security workflows.
Misconfigurations.Message: VPC does not have VPC Flow Logs enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable flow logs for VPC

Misconfigurations.Title: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
Misconfigurations.Description: VPC Flow Logs provide visibility into network traffic that traverses the VPC and can be used to detect anomalous traffic or insight during security workflows.
Misconfigurations.Message: VPC does not have VPC Flow Logs enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable flow logs for VPC

Misconfigurations.Title: Lambda functions should have X-Ray tracing enabled
Misconfigurations.Description: X-Ray tracing enables end-to-end debugging and analysis of all function activity. This will allow for identifying bottlenecks, slow downs and timeouts.
Misconfigurations.Message: Function does not have tracing enabled.
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable tracing

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Data should be versioned
Misconfigurations.Description:
Versioning in Amazon S3 is a means of keeping multiple variants of an object in the same bucket.

You can use the S3 Versioning feature to preserve, retrieve, and restore every version of every object stored in your buckets.

With versioning you can recover more easily from both unintended user actions and application failures.
Misconfigurations.Message: Bucket does not have versioning enabled
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable versioning to protect against accidental/malicious removal or modification

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access Block should Ignore Public ACL
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should ignore public ACLs on buckets and any objects they contain. By ignoring rather than blocking, PUT calls with public ACLs will still be applied but the ACL will be ignored.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not ignore public ACLs
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable ignoring the application of public ACLs in PUT calls

Misconfigurations.Title: S3 Access block should restrict public bucket to limit access
Misconfigurations.Description: S3 buckets should restrict public policies for the bucket. By enabling, the restrict_public_buckets, only the bucket owner and AWS Services can access if it has a public policy.
Misconfigurations.Message: Public access block does not restrict public buckets
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Limit the access to public buckets to only the owner or AWS Services (eg; CloudFront)

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Enable encryption using customer managed keys
